note.p: Meaning, literally, “shelf timber” or “stand-in timber,” (Kroll) the term timu 替木 is predominantly found in architectural literature from the Song, Ming, and Qing dynasties. The timu stabilizes the structure by increasing the surface area between the upper and lower components. In the connection between the circular purlins (tuan 槫 or lin 檁) and dou (bearing block), it facilitates the transition between circular and rectangular elements, thereby improving the stability of the block's support for the circular purlin. According to the Qing dynasty Gongcheng zuofa, the timu is located above the pillar to support the purlin. According to Ma Bingjian’s research on late Qing architecture, elements joined into the pillar top to protect the half-tenon joints between the beams and pillars can also be called timu. In this case the timu functions similarly to the queti (雀替 sparrow brace), but it has a different shape.

The earliest mention of timu appears in Guo Ruoxu's “Experiences in Painting” (Tuhua jianwenzhi 圖畫見聞志) from the Song dynasty. The Song dynasty architectural manual Yingzao fashi 营造法式 describes it as a short wooden component positioned between the dougong 斗栱 and a circular purlin (tuan 槫). The timu typically features rounded ends (juansha 卷殺) measuring ten fen in thickness and twelve fen in height, with its length extending slightly beyond the underlying dougong. Yingzao fashi refers to timu alternatively as fu 複 or fudong 複棟 (Guo 2001, 2; Li 2009, voll, 4, 5).

Contemporary scholars suggest that the timu may have evolved from the ji 枅, a horizontal wooden element placed atop columns during the Han dynasty. This architectural feature is believed to have gradually developed into various components including the fang 枋 (squared beam), dougong 斗拱 (bracket set), and queti 雀替 (sparrow brace) (Fu 1981, 54; Li 2005, 55; Tang 2016, 131; Ma 1991, 237; Li 2005, 218).
替木作為建築術語，最早見於《圖畫見聞誌》（郭 2001,2），主要出現於宋、明、清的文獻。宋、清文獻中的替木所指並不完全相同。

根據《營造法式》，替木為施於枓栱上，，圓槫下的短木構件（李 2009，vol1,4,5）。替木通過加大上下構件間的接觸面，起到維護結構穩定性的作用。其在圓形的槫与枓的连接中上下过渡，加強了枓對槫的支撐的 穩定性。清官式营造文献（王等 2000，379；清工部 1734，26.5b,27.4b,48.4b,61.4a）中，小式建築四檁大木（清工部 1734，27.4b）和五檁大木（清工部 1734，26.5b）做法里，金檁或脊檩下不使用枋與墊板時，柱頭上或梁上置 替木承托檁条，有助於維持槫或檁之間的連接。根據馬炳堅的研究，清代建築中，中柱、山柱上梁柱交接时，梁下穿过柱身的短木構件也被称为替木。(馬炳堅,1991,194)，此種構件保護了梁柱間的半榫節點，作用類似雀替，但形狀不同。
近代學者通過整理文獻與實物，對“替木”展開討論。認為其可能來源於漢代的枅（傅熹年,1981,54）或柱頂橫木（李允鉌，2005：55），後發展演化為枋（湯崇平，2016，131）、枓拱(馬炳堅,1991,237)、雀替 （李允鉌，2005：218）。
